"adam.weall" <adam_jw@...> wrote:   Hi all,

I am trying to simulate a piston using a moving wall in a batch reactor.

I use the following from a cantera tutorial,

omega=2*pi*(frequency)
coeffs =[(0.0 ,0.0), (0.0, (amplitude)]
piston_rate =Fourier(omega,coeffs)
w=Wall( env,r1,velocity=piston_rate)

I can get this to work.

But I cant find any documentation on the Fourier function in cantera. 
Does anyone know any more?

The form of the function "velocity" is not clear. It is refered to as 
a 'functor'? and I want to be able to understand how to pass time based 
functions for heat transfer and velocity to the wall object.

Thanks in advance for any info,
Adam.
